channel.title: Keyboard code for return?
channel.description:
im trying to make a script which removes all ' and + from a bitmap string sequence,
i use [scar] if(pos(chr(13),bmpstring)<>0)then delete(bmpstring(pos(chr(13),bmpstring),1); [/scar]
that removes most of the returns, but it leaves a few,
my question is, what other keyboard codes mean enter as well iv tried chr(108), but it still leaves enters
iv heard that java also uses keyboard codes, maybe some java person knows

item.title: Keyboard code for return?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

13 and 10 are usually the line feed chars.
So try 10.

Read full topic

item.title: Keyboard code for return?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yakman, try my ReplaceAll() function. Then simply do this to replace all the single quotes with nothing.

[scar]
BitmapString := ReplaceAll(BitmapString, ‘’’’, ‘’);
[/scar]

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Keyboard code for return?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

im trying to make a form which you write the width, height and copy the bitmap string, then it shows you what the bitmap looks like

its meant to go past the 40x40 cap, iv already made something like this but i was trying to make it into forms

as you can see, chr(13) gets rid of most returns, but leaves some, when i copy the symbol into notepad, it does a new line, so im sure its enter

i think ill try that if not a-z thing

Read full topic

item.title: Keyboard code for return?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I read the thread just not code.

I don’t know exactly what your doing, but if your in a hurry a little script from clickmouse, delete will work fine.

Have you tried somthing like seeing if the current letter of the string is ',+ then delete it, else if it’s not a-z, 1-0 then delete again?

Read full topic

it seems there another code for enter

item.title: Keyboard code for return?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

im trying to make a script which removes all ’ and + from a bitmap string sequence,

i use
[scar]
if(pos(chr(13),bmpstring)<>0)then
delete(bmpstring(pos(chr(13),bmpstring),1);
[/scar]

that removes most of the returns, but it leaves a few,

my question is, what other keyboard codes mean enter as well
iv tried chr(108), but it still leaves enters

iv heard that java also uses keyboard codes, maybe some java person knows
